Thanks for the contribution. I don't think this is a strict improvement, so I'm going to stick with the status quo and close the change. In particular, placing map before shuffle can be a better move if the map reduces the size of a record, and hence reduces the overall memory pressure of the shuffle buffer.

It might be worth making a follow-up change to the tf.data performance guide that makes a similar point to the one you intended, and we'd welcome a PR for that.

body:
Thanks for the contribution. I don't think this is a strict improvement, so I'm going to stick with the status quo and close the change. In particular, placing map before shuffle can be a better move if the map *reduces the size* of a record, and hence reduces the overall memory pressure of the shuffle buffer.

It might be worth making a follow-up change to the [`tf.data` performance guide](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/docs_src/performance/datasets_performance.md) that makes a similar point to the one you intended, and we'd welcome a PR for that.
